title: WWE Appoints Vince McMahon's Daughter as Interim CEO Amid Probe; Stephanie McMahon to also serve as interim chairwoman; Vince McMahon steps back from his role as CEO, chairman
text:
The Wall Street Journal reported Wednesday that the board was looking into a secret $3 million settlement that Mr. McMahon agreed to pay to a departing employee with whom he allegedly had an affair.

Mr. McMahon said Friday that he would cooperate with and "do everything possible to support" the investigation. "I have also pledged to accept the findings and outcome of the investigation, whatever they are," he said.

The board said Mr. McMahon would retain his responsibilities related to WWE's creative content as the investigation proceeds.

Ms. McMahon most recently served as WWE's chief brand officer. She stepped away from the role last month, writing in a LinkedIn post at the time that she was "taking this time to focus on my family" but planned to return to the company.

Write to Dean Seal at dean.seal@wsj.com

WWE Appoints Vince McMahon's Daughter as Interim CEO Amid Probe
